item.title: Jeju Air plane crash raises questions about concrete wall at the end of the runway
item.description: Some aviation experts say the damage could have been minimized had the plane not collided with the concrete wall.

item.title: Military appeals court lets 9/11 plea deals proceed after defense secretary moves to rescind them
item.description: The U.S. Court of Military Commission Review rejected Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin's attempt to unravel plea agreements with three 9/11 defendants.

item.title: The housing market is heading into 2025 with a worrying supply trend
item.description: More than half of homes for sale in November had sat on the market for at least 60 days without going under a contract of sale.

item.title: Silicon Valley's turn of fortune: Intel has worst year ever, while Broadcom enjoys record gain
item.description: Intel lost over 60% of its value in 2024, the biggest drop in its 53 years as a public company. Broadcom's stock price more than doubled.

item.title: Boeing 737-800, the model that crashed in South Korea, is one of the world's most popular aircraft
item.description: Accident investigators are trying to find the cause of a Jeju Air fatal crash landing that killed 179 of the 181 on board the flight.
